perturbation.original_text: “Authorized Work” means non-commercial activities restricted to research and development, pilot plant, deployment, and demonstration projects, and commercial activities for which FCE has obtained the prior written consent of ExxonMobil.
perturbation.changed_text: “Authorized Work” means non-commercial activities restricted to research and development, pilot plant, deployment, and demonstration projects. All commercial activities are strictly prohibited.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by first defining 'Authorized Work' to include commercial activities with consent, and then stating all commercial activities are strictly prohibited. This creates uncertainty regarding the permissibility of commercial activities under the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
“FTE Costs” means the product of the FTE Rate and the hours worked of the total number of FTEs.
“FTE Rate” means the hourly amount agreed to by the Parties per FTE. As of the Effective Date, the FTE Rate for scientists and engineers is three-hundred and twenty-seven United States dollars ($327.00 USD) and the FTE Rate for all other FTEs is one-hundred and ninety-four United States dollars ($194.00 USD). Increases in the FTE Rate must be approved by the Steering Committee.
perturbation.changed_text:
“FTE Costs” means the product of the FTE Rate and the hours worked of the total number of FTEs.
“FTE Rate” means the hourly amount agreed to by the Parties per FTE. As of the Effective Date, the FTE Rate for all personnel is two-hundred and fifty United States dollars ($250.00 USD). Increases in the FTE Rate are not permitted.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines different FTE rates for scientists/engineers and other FTEs, and allows for increases approved by the Steering Committee. The modified text establishes a single FTE rate for all personnel and prohibits any increases. This contradiction would cause disputes over invoicing and cost management.
